reference.title: Updated Time Spent Calculation
reference.shortdesc: In SiteCatalyst 14, if a visitor spent 00:01:15 on a Web page, the reported Time Spent on Page metric would be 00:02:00.

refsyn.p: The midpoint value of the 1 to 3 minute range.
SiteCatalyst 15 uses explicit values (including link events and video views) to calculate Time Spent, so the reported Time Spent on Page value in this example would be 00:01:15.
The following table describes the differences in how Time Spent is calculated:

row.entry: Time Stamp: Calculates a visitor's Time Spent value based on Web beacon time stamps generated by the visitor's page views.
Time Stamp + Link Event: Calculates a visitor's Time Spent value based on Web beacon time stamps generated by the visitor's page views and link events (custom, download, exit, and video).
Ranged Values: Reports Time Spent metrics using a midpoint value based on ten time buckets (or ranges), such as 30 to 60 seconds, 1 to 3 minutes, and 5 to 10 minutes.
Explicit Values: Reports the explicit Time Spent value, eliminating the use of midpoint values and time buckets.

Midpoint Average: Calculates average
Time Spent metrics using the midpoint values rather than the explicit Time Spent values.

Explicit Average: Calculates average
Time Spent metrics using explicit Time Spent values rather than the midpoint
Time Spent values.
Attribution: All Time Spent values are attributed on the day that the visit ends, even if some of the page views were on a previous day.
Attribution: All Time Spent values are attributed to the day on which each page view occurred.

refsyn.p: Because of these changes in calculation, SiteCatalyst 15 Time Spent metrics can vary significantly from previous versions of SiteCatalyst. Sites with a video implementation should see an increase.
Without non-page events like video views or exit links, time spent on the last page cannot be known.
